intro: Oenothera pallida subsp. pallida, commonly known as the pale evening primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically 2–4 cm in diameter and have four petals. Oenothera pallida subsp. pallida is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
